title: Snowfall Amounts
question_text: A meteorologist in a small town has been keeping track of annual snowfall amounts for the last $65\text{ years}$ . The annual snowfall has an average of $54\text{ inches}$ with a standard deviation of $9.8\text{ inches}$ . This year a local citizen claimed the town received $124.5\text{ inches}$ of snow. Based on this information, one can conclude

choices.text: A mistake was likely made in recording snowfall amounts.
This year was surprisingly snowy but is not a huge abnormality.
The interquartile range must be well over 9.8 inches 9.8 inches .
Before the point 124.5 124.5 was added, this distribution was right skewed.
The median will be greater than the mean for this distribution.
